project.name: Proctors
project.description: The Gentoo proctors are responsible to make Gentoo a friendly and productive place by enforcing the Code of Conduct.
project.longdescription: Gentoo uses many public media such as mailing lists, forums, irc, bugzilla, etc. Following the Code of Conduct is a minimum requirement for all of them. The proctors are responsible to make sure it is followed, especially on the mailing lists. They work together with moderators of other media such as the #gentoo operators and the forum moderators. Additionally, members of the council (who are not acting as proctors) are here helping with advice and looking that things are done properly according to the intentions of the council.

body.p: A lot of things are being said and posted in the community every day. While the more prominent violations of the CoC may be spotted by the proctors themselves, it is impossible to keep up with every post. If you think the CoC is not followed somewhere, you have the following options:

ul.li: You can report Guideline violations on the forums directly to the forum moderators.
For #gentoo, please talk to the people in #gentoo-ops.

If it is in another medium like the mailing lists, you have the feeling the issue is not only limited to one of the media already moderated primarily by another group of moderators, or not taken seriously enough by them, please contact us using the alias proctors@gentoo.org.
The proctors are usually in #gentoo-proctors, but since they are not reading along all the time, it is usually better to use email so your issue does not get lost.

body.p: Executing Gentoo's Code of Conduct is a sensitive issue. As a consequence proctors are carefully selected. These are some minimum requirements that can be evaluated on a case by case basis:

ul.li: Must be a respected member of the Gentoo community. Of course this is hard to put into numbers or other hard facts, but new additions to the team need to be acknowledged by the existing team members first.
All proctors have to be impartial. We realize it may sometimes be hard to do this, but acting as a team fair decisions should be made. However, every proctor should be as neutral as possible.

Must be Gentoo staff for at least 6 months. Proctors gain access to sensitive infrastructure and are therefor required to already have developer/staff status. Recruiting new people only for being a proctor is not encouraged in general.
Must not be a member of the Gentoo Council due to conflicts of interest.
